conclusion: Analyze forces on the copper rod MN before and after energization.
Identify forces when the rod is not energized: weight mg balanced by tension in wires.
Calculate tension in each wire when not energized: T0 = mg/2.
Identify forces when the rod is energized: additional magnetic force acts.
Magnetic force is Lorentz force: FB = BIL.
Direction of magnetic force is upward using right-hand rule.
New tension in each wire when energized: T = mg/8.
Set up equilibrium equation for energized rod: mg - BIL + 2T = 0.
Substitute T = mg/8 into equilibrium equation.
Determine direction of current: from M to N.
